ygData.subject: Re: Suicide King
ygData.msgSnippet: I have something to say and some of you may not want to hear it.  Those of you whom I talk to outside of this know my personal opinions but this is not about

Received: from Rudra656@... by imo-r09.mx.aol.com (mail_out_v29.5.) id r.3a.104baa7d (26121) for <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>; Fri, 2 Feb 2001 15:55:55 -0500 (EST)
Message-ID: <3a.104baa7d.27ac78db@...>
Date: Fri, 2 Feb 2001 15:55:55 EST
Subject: Re: Suicide King
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: AOL 5.0 for Windows sub 129
From: Rudra656@...

    I have something to say and some of you may not want to hear it.  Those 
of you whom I talk to outside of this know my personal opinions but this is 
not about those.  This is about tact.

    I am a cynic and a skeptic by nature.  I am also emotionally detached 
when it comes to matters of death and opinion.  JP, you made a foolish 
mistake by saying that in front of his friends.  I am not saying you are 
right or wrong, I have no way of knowing.  However this will not be finished 
until there is mourning, appropriate or not.  And I, for one, do not here to 
see depressing comments and petty arguments.

    I would like to end this message with one last piece of advice: Do not 
pity those who have died by their own hand, for they no longer must cope with 
the problems of life.  Pity those who must live with the consequences of his 
decision.  Pity those who are forced to live with the people who brought him 
to the point where suicide is possible.  And finally, pity those who brought 
him to the point where suicide is possible for they will be forever filled 
with guilt for this tragedy.
